chapter_description.p: Functions manager provides tools to manage and interact with Nelson's function search path and function types.
It includes commands to add or remove directories from the search path, execute built-in functions, clear built-in functions, evaluate functions, and more.
Utilities are available to check for the existence of built-in, macro, or mex functions.

keyword.name: addpath
keyword.description: Add directories to functions search path.

keyword.name: isbuiltin
keyword.description: Check for the existence of a builtin.

keyword.name: ismacro
keyword.description: Check for the existence of a macro (function).

keyword.name: ismex
keyword.description: Check for the existence of a mex function.

keyword.name: macroargs
keyword.description: Returns variables names of a function.

keyword.name: path
keyword.description: Modify or display Nelson’s load path.

keyword.name: rehash
keyword.description: Reinitialize Nelson’s search path directory cache.

keyword.name: restoredefaultpath
keyword.description: Restore Nelson’s path to its initial state at startup.

keyword.name: userpath
keyword.description: Displays or modify default user functions directory.

keyword.name: what
keyword.description: Get Nelson builtin and macro list.
